channel.title: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds
channel.description: I seriously need to know how to use these, sounds like strain, bumble, gossip, secret, castle. Knowledge is power.

item.title: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds
item.dc:creator: Morgen
item.description:
Glad I saw this thread, I didn’t see it originally. Great question! I need to ask more questions like this. What’s funny about those sounds you listed is many of them are sounds I use routinely but I’m often discouraged that my sound is so rough/lo-fi sounding in comparison to artists such as yourself. So I need to learn how to use them as well.

I guess what I could add is about “Bee”. I’ve never been able to use it as a bass line but it’s the best instrument for “acid” sounds when you play with tone and shape. That’s a style from 80s and 90s with a very specific sound. A couple places I fell like I was able to use it effectively were:

https://soundcloud.com/morgan-handley-1/rocket-ship-remix (1:55-2:35 or so, I especially like 2:30)

but I feel like a really good example of this is:

https://soundcloud.com/morgan-handley-1/were-all-just-humans-here (2:30-3:20)

Read full topic

item.title: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds
item.dc:creator: Xicon
item.description:
Strain: Used for Chords
Bumble: Used as a Bass
Gossip: Used for Synth Chords
Secret: Used for Low Leads
Castle: Used for Chords, Leads, & Siren/Buildups

-drops mic-

item.source: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds

item.title: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Don’t know if anybody else said this already, but Strain is good for a layered supersaw, especially with Otter and Jelly. Strain can also be used well with Gossip in leads. For Bumble, I sometimes use it for a contrabass, or to give a lead some low end. Castle is a nice plucky sound. Good for plucky chords along with Igloo and Climb, also good as a pseudo-organ in the lower registers. Finally… Secret. Secret basically has no more use by itself, unless you like corny, novel honky-tonk pianos… actually, try it layered with Grain or Chalk or even Tourist and Transfer (lowpass recommended for layering with the two in Vintage Keys). And Secret is also pretty okay as a weird pad sound, especially with lowpass.

Read full topic

item.title: Best ways to use strain and other terrifying sounds
item.dc:creator: anon83262203
item.description:
For Strain, I used to layer that with chords sometimes. Gossip is also good for chord layering and lead layering, though I don’t really use it anymore. As for Castle, that’s one of my favorite leads for songs with a creepy vibe. I can send an example if you want.

Bumble and Secret I can’t really help with, sorry.
